business.headline: Cabinet approves MSP for rabi crops for marketing season 2025-26The decision was taken to ensure better income for farmers and to promote the cultivation of key crops during the Rabi season.

Central government employees get early Diwali gift with 3% DA hikeDearness Allowance hike: The additional 3% increase is expected to ease the financial burden on government employees amid rising inflation.

DA hike announcement likely today. Here's what we know It could be an early Diwali for central government employees and pensioners, as the government is set to make an official announcement about the 3% DA hike today.

New ITR e-filing portal 3.0 launching soon: All you need to knowAccording to an internal circular dated October 8, 2024, the new portal, part of Project IEC 3.0, will replace the current system and introduce advanced features for smoother and more secure filing of income tax returns.

Much appreciated: Elon Musk on Centre confirming no spectrum auctionIn a recent announcement by Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, confirmed that India would allocate spectrum administratively, following global norms.

Hyundai IPO: GMP rises marginally, should you subscribe? Hyundai Motors India IPO: The share price has been set between Rs 1,865 and Rs 1,960 per share. With this IPO, Hyundai aims to raise a massive Rs 27,856 crore, making it the largest public offering in India's history.

How much DA hike will central government employees get? Details hereDearness Allowance, a key component of compensation for over one crore central government employees and pensioners, is designed to shield them from inflationary pressures.

Gold, silver price today, October 16, 2024: Precious metals record hike on MCXGold Price Today October 16, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the higher side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Wednesday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.
Explained: Why analysts are bullish on PVR Inox despite falling share pricePVR Inox shares: Although PVR Inox shares have fallen over 5% this year, several brokerages are optimistic about the company

Cochin Shipyard shares down 4% today as 2-day OFS begins. Check detailsCochin Shipyard share price: The OFS, which started on October 16, is open only to non-retail investors today. The floor price for the sale is set at Rs 1,540 per share, a 7.89% discount to Tuesday's closing price of Rs 1,672.
Sensex, Nifty witness volatile trade as FII outflow dents sentimentsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 50.20 points to 81,870.32 at 9:51 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 15.35 points to trade at 25,072.70.

No spectrum auction: Government after Elon Musk objects to Mukesh Ambani's pitchTelecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has announced that India will follow the global trend of administrative spectrum allocation. The decision came after Starlink CEO Elon Musk objected to Ambani's Reliance Jio lobbying for the auction route.

DA hike update: Central government employees can expect big Diwali giftThe expected hike in DA would mean that over 1 crore central government employees and pensioners will receive their October salaries with the new DA rate, along with three months' worth of arrears.
LIC Mutual Fund reduces daily minimum SIP limit to Rs 100Investors can now begin a SIP with just Rs 100 and in multiples of Re 1 thereafter for select schemes of LIC Mutual Fund (LIC MF).

Hyundai IPO: Should you buy shares after its listing?While the buzz surrounding the IPO is palpable, many brokerages are urging investors to take a cautious approach. They advise looking at Hyundai's long-term growth potential rather than getting caught up in the excitement of quick listing gains.

Hyundai IPO: Why investors should focus on long-term growth, not listing gainsHyundai Motor IPO: While Hyundai's IPO is undoubtedly generating excitement, experts are saying this is more of a marathon than a sprint.

Hyundai IPO: Check latest subscription and GMP on Day 1Hyundai Motor India IPO: India's biggest public offering opened for subscription on Monday, looking to raise Rs 27,870.16 crore with an offer for sale of 14.22 crore shares.

RIL shares dip 1% after Q2 results. What should investors do? Reliance Industries share price: The dip, driven by weaker-than-expected performance in its oil-to-chemicals (O2C) segment, has left investors and analysts contemplating their next move.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Our Chief Minister is here: Did Devendra Fadnavis confirm Mahayuti's face?The tactical answer by Devendra Fadnavis is being seen as a move to not antagonise the Mahayuti allies ahead of the November 20 Maharashtra Assembly polls.

Akasa Air, IndiGo flights get bomb threats, 12th such incident in 3 daysA Bengaluru-Delhi Akasa Air flight and Delhi-Mumbai IndiGo flight got bomb threats amid a series of hoax calls in the past three days.

S Jaishankar's '3 evils' message on terror at SCO Summit, swipe at PakistanExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, at the SCO summit, criticised Pakistan, stating that cross-border extremism and separatism hinder bilateral trade and relations.

What is moderate drinking for the Indian appetite?Moderate drinking generally refers to a level of alcohol consumption that is considered low-risk for most adults, meaning it minimises potential health risks while allowing for social enjoyment.

Omar Abdullah takes oath as J&K Chief Minister, Surinder Choudhary his deputyOmar Abdullah took oath as Chief Minister for the second time. He is the first to assume office after the scrapping of Article 370 in Jammu and Kashmir and the erstwhile state becoming a Union Territory in 2019.

What's Five Eyes staring at India amid Canada stand-offIn the probe into the attack on Hardeep Singh Nijjar and Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, Canada and the US seem to be coordinating their moves. That is because the two are part of Five Eyes, a powerful, close-knit intelligence-sharing grouping. Here's more about Five Eyes and why Justin Trudeau is using it for leverage.

Gigi and Bella Hadid, Ashley Graham take Victoria's Secret Fashion Show by stormThe 2024 Victoria's Secret Fashion Show returned on October 15, featuring diverse models like Gigi Hadid and Ashley Graham. Highlights included performances by Cher and a focus on inclusivity.

Rajasthan: The Royal Canvas for Dream WeddingsWhether it's the grandeur of a palace wedding in Udaipur, the mystique of a desert wedding in Jaisalmer, or the creativity of a themed wedding in Jaipur, Rajasthan offers a wedding experience that is truly out of the ordinary.

IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme: Shaping the Future of Tech LeadershipAdvance your career with IIT Delhi's Technology & AI Leadership Programme. Designed for aspiring tech leaders, this programme offers cutting-edge insights, practical experience, and strategic acumen to navigate the digital era. Gain the skills to drive innovation, lead digital transformations, and position yourself as a visionary in technology leadership.

Nayab Singh Saini chosen Haryana BJP Legislative Party leader day before oathToday's development came a day ahead of Nayab Singh Saini's swearing-in as the Chief Minister of Haryana for a second time following the BJP's historic win in the October 5 Assembly polls.
Why Maharashtra waived the toll on light vehicles at Mumbai entry pointsA long-standing demand, the waiver brings respite to motorists and commuters but detractors flag the timing ahead of elections

Muda chief resigns amid Karnataka land allotment row involving SiddaramaiahMuda chief K Marigowda has resigned from his post citing health reasons. His resignation came at a time when a probe has been going on against Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in connection with the Muda land allotment case.

Canadian Sikh MP wants sanctions on Indian diplomats, gets mocked by journalistsAmid the India-Canada diplomatic row, Canadian Sikh MP Jagmeet Singh was mocked by journalists at a press conference when he demanded "severe sanctions" on Indian diplomats and ducked further questions while walking out of the room.

Complete defiance: Supreme Court blasts Punjab, Haryana over Delhi air pollutionThe Supreme Court directed the Commission of Air Quality Management to take penal action against state government officers and directed the Haryana Chief Secretary to be present in court next Wednesday.

Baba Siddique's shooters learnt to use guns by watching YouTube videos: ReportFour accused people have been arrested so far in connection to the NCP leader's murder that took place on the night of October 12 outside his MLA son Zeeshan Siddique's office in Mumbai's Bandra.

Why 18% GST on life and health insurance is high and must be slashedIndians are paying an 18% GST on term and health insurance premiums, which is higher than what people pay in the US, the UK and South Africa -- a Brics country. This is why experts suggest that the GST Council should bring down tax on insurance premiums.

Bhavana Pandey recalls looking at Boney Kapoor instead of Chunky on Karwa ChauthKapil Sharma will host the cast of Fabulous Lives Vs Bollywood Wives for a Karwa Chauth special on The Great Indian Kapil Show. The episode airs on Netflix on October 19.

Arjun Sarja announces new film Seetha Payana, casts Upendra's nephew as heroActor-director Arjun Sarja returned to direction after six years, as he announced his next project Seetha Payana. The film stars Kannada star Upendra's nephew Niranjan Sudhindra in the lead.

Infinix Zero Flip to debut in India on October 17: Pricing to specs, 5 things we already knowInfinix is all set to enter the market of foldable smartphones. The company is launching the Infinix Zero Flip on October 17, and it is expected to cost below Rs 50,000.

Amazon is offering a big discount on iPhone 13The iPhone 13 is again available with a big discount offer, giving people a chance to buy this device at a lower price point. Amazon is selling at Rs 42,499 and interested buyers can get this device at Rs 40,000 with select bank offers.

Lionel Messi remains coy on Argentina future: These can be my last gamesLionel Messi has remained coy on his future and claimed that he could be playing his final few games on October 15, Tuesday. Messi scored his 10th international hat-trick against Bolivia.

1st Test Day 1 Weather Updates: Rain washes out first day of openerIND vs NZ, 1st Test Day 1 Weather Updates: Day 1 of the Bengaluru Test has been called off due to rain. Despite the hopes of fans, the rain was playing a bit of hide and seek on Wednesday. Day 2 is expected to have an early start with toss taking place at 8:45 am IST and the game starting at 9:15 am.

IND vs NZ: Rohit, Kohli, Ashwin on the brink of major milestones ahead of 1st TestIndia players Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Ravichandran Ashwin are on the brink of shattering major milestones in the first Test against New Zealand in Bengaluru.

Nations League: Spain thrash Serbia to reach quarters, Portugal held by ScotlandSpain has reached the quarterfinals of the UEFA Nations League with a commanding 3-0 win over Serbia on October 15, Tuesday. Portugal also edge closer to the knockout stages, despite being held to a 0-0 draw by Scotland.

Can Virat Kohli hit top Test gear against New Zealand before flight to Australia?As India prepares to face New Zealand in the Bengaluru Test, all eyes are on Virat Kohli to finally click into his usual run-scoring form. After a lean run so far in 2024, the series offers a key opportunity for him to regain form ahead of the high-profile Border Gavaskar Trophy.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
